All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
BoundingBox
Each Shape is surrounded by an associated BoundingBox.
Circle
A Circle inherits from Shape.
Consts
Collected constants of general utility.
CustomPanel
This allows us to create a panel which we can add to a frame/window Oftentimes, you would then add standard GUI components, e.g.
CustomWindow
We can think of a JFrame as a window By extending (inheriting from) the class javax.swing.JFrame we can define what goes into our window - in this case a single JPanel which is a component container for GUI elements.
Main
 
Moveable
Any Shape implementing the Moveable interface can move ten units.
Pair<U,V>
This Pair record was created for tracking X and Y points.
Point
The Point class was created to adhere to the UML provided in the requirements.
Quadrilateral
A Quadrilateral is a Polygon that inherits from Shape and has exactly 4 sides/vertices.
Rectangle
A Rectangle inherits from Shape and implements Moveable.
Rotatable
Any Shape implementing the Rotatable interface can rotate ninety degrees.
Shape
This abstract superclass is extended by the various shape classes.
ShapesManager
ShapesManager is used to manage an ArrayList of Shape's.
Square
A Square inherits from Rectangle and provides very little extra functionality not already offered by Rectangle.
